website_summaries.verdict: Logitech's Ultrathin Keyboard Cover might be the best keyboard accessory ever made for the iPad, if you're looking for a highly portable and functional keyboard that travels light; just make sure you carry a separate protective case.
pros: The Logitech Ultrathin Keyboard Cover has a slim design, fits perfectly onto the iPad 2 and third-generation iPad via magnets, and works extremely well as a keyboard
cons: The plastic-and-aluminum keyboard isn't really a case, and it doesn't protect the back of the iPad

customer_reviews.title: Great accessory
customer_reviews.text: Owned/used for several months now. Pros: -Light-weight -Attractive finish matches the iPad aluminum. -Relatively solid build quality. -Long battery. Auto-sleep. -Pairs quickly and easily with the iPad. -Nice tactile feel to keyboard. -Attaches snug and firmly. Cons: -Magnets could be a little stronger. -Bottom has no rubber pads or feet which makes it slide somewhat and scratches the nice aluminum in spots. Minor but stupid oversight. Overall very pleased and this keyboard has increased the utility of my iPad (for work especially). I would buy another in the future.
customer_reviews.author: P. Cody

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but very good.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned other keyboards that weren't nearly as rugged and dependable as the Logitech Ultrathin. I bought this one used in "like new" condition and, so far, it's performed very well. The key strokes are fast and easy, and are accurately translated to my iPad. No complaints on performance. I also love the sleek, clean look of the unit. The slot holds the iPad securely enough. I do have 1 issue: One of the keys popped off and got lost. Bummer! I still give the keyboard 4 stars because, compared to other keyboards I've tried where multiple keys went missing, I can deal with the minor disappointment. It shouldn't happen, but perhaps it's the 'nature of the beast...'
customer_reviews.author: warbler

customer_reviews.title: Groove does NOT keep iPad securely standing up.
customer_reviews.text: Nice enough. Materials: outer metal is nice, smooth glossy plastic always looks dirty, keyboard is tight but has a nice field. Battery lasts well, depending on usage, but does last a while if using it more as a iPad stand. The Groove: is not deep enough for the iPad and often falls out.
customer_reviews.author: Louis J. Rossi

customer_reviews.title: Best iPad keyboard EXCEPT:
customer_reviews.text: This is the best keyboard I have ever used in this size range. I purchased a second after I wore out the first. I do a lot of keyboarding. Will definately purchase again, and I hope they don't stop making them. UPDATE: keyboard, which is great as I said above, has almost lost magnetization not long after purchase, so iPad falls off keyboard. I have now banged up iPad up several times from falling off this keyboard, and have ordered another case with stand. I suppose I can still use keyboard, but not attached to iPad. I don't recommend this keyboard because of magnet issue.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Albert

customer_reviews.title: Good Logitech Product
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard was ordered to replace another inexpensive iPad keyboard that stopped working. It fits my generation 2 iPad well. The magnet on the hinge is strong and holds the iPad securely. When turned on, the Bluetooth attaches quickly and stays on as long as the case is opened, even if you let the iPad shut off from inactivity. It comes right back as soon as the iPad wakes up. The keys are a little flat, but have a good positive feel and make touch typing easy. The instructions promise up to 6 month's use between charges. I have charged it once but have not used it enough to see how long a charge will last. Overall, a good product.
customer_reviews.author: JBM 63

customer_reviews.title: Great Device
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a gift for my brother. It took him awhile to figure out how to stand his ipad up on this device (he was leaning it against something). But your ipad can free stand by itself. Also, this device needs to be charged (something my brother also didn't know). It comes with a charger (somehow my brothers didn't). So I contacted the seller and they were SO kind and actually sent us a new one free of charge. Sometime later my brother ended up discovering his amongst the packaging. Overall great product, the technical difficulties stemmed from my brothers doing. Plus the seller was beyond helpful.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: They're very good at requiring me to fill out forms but very ...
customer_reviews.text: No, this product did not meet my expectations! I purchased it on September 15, 2015. By October 4, the keyboard was skipping several specific characters, making this thing virtually worthless for me. I contacted Logitech TWICE to tell them about the problem and at least so far, I have NOT had a response. They're very good at requiring me to fill out forms but very bad at providing an actual response! I could not be MORE unhappy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie L. Glickson

customer_reviews.title: Looks Great, Works well
customer_reviews.text: Very Solid choice for IPAD. I use it daily; primarily with Evernote. I use the keyboard in combination with a "Built" slip on case. This prevents the iPad from separating with the cover in my laptop bag. Keys feel good but small. It took me longer than I expected to get used to using different keystrokes for cut, paste, etc. Hint: You need to make sure the iPad is inserted in the slot correctly. If you put the control side down (side switch and volume), the iPad is unstable and will easily fall out of the slot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall good keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a "reconditioned" keyboard and knew there may be slight blemishes. Initially I was dissapointed to find a dent on the edge of the metal back casing. Considered returning the keyboard but ultimately opted to keep. I was able to straighten the dent with some needle nose plyers with only minor scratches evident. Keyboard was obviously previously used and I am doubtful it was truly "refurbished". Everything works on the keyboard and I have been using it regularly. I will live with the scratches and slight blemishes for the cost savings as a new cover would only get scratched from my own use. The dent was a downer though.
customer_reviews.author: William Barrows

customer_reviews.title: Love it...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect keyboard case for my iPad2. The magnetic hinge works great to keep the cover in place when closed. The keyboard case provides very good protection for the iPad. The keys are just the right level of touch-sensitive and easy to use. While in use, the magnetic channel is very strong to hold the iPad in either landscape or portrait orientation. I returned another purchase, the Anker keyboard cover, because the hold just wasn't strong enough. It is ultra thin, which is exactly what I wanted. You really don't need an neoprene bag, but could if you want extra protection.
customer_reviews.author: ThriftyShopper

customer_reviews.title: Thank you for making this!
customer_reviews.text: I believe I’ve had this for over 3 years and still works with current devices due to the Bluetooth function. As crazy as it seems, this is a good buy still! More to love but you need to buy this yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Slim, Stylish, iPad Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard for travel and conferences. The magnetic attachment makes it very convenient to attach and remove, although I fear that one day I may lose it. The silver finish matches the stock finish beautifully and makes the combination look extremely polished. One issue is that it doesn't offer any protection to the iPad and the keyboard bottom may get scratched from normal use. Pros: Easy Bluetooth connection, modern & sleek design, extremely lightweight, portable Cons: Smaller keys than normal keyboard, detachable (i.e., potential to separate/lose), doesn't protect back of iPad, scratchable surface Overall: 4.5 stars. Highly recommended for those looking for a stylish and portable iPad keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Z

customer_reviews.title: Great iPad accessory!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this keyboard after reading reviews of many different keyboards for the iPad. I am so happy that this keyboard was the one I chose! It is a very practical keyboard and doubles as a cover for the iPad. You need to make sure that the magnetic strip to attach it as a cover is on the side of the iPad WITHOUT the volume control because it attaches better on that side. The keyboard is almost full size, and the keys are in alignment with a regular keyboard. The battery lasts a long time, so if you're at an all-day meeting taking notes, you won't run out of power mid-day. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: H. C. Waters

customer_reviews.title: Easy to connect. Long battery life. Wonderful function. Holds ipad well. Okay as a case, but best to slide into a padded sleeve.
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my third one of these. I can't live without one. Protects the screen well, but I still put the keyboard & ipad into a Built sleeve to provide some padding for both items. Holds a charge for a long time. Long enough that it takes me a bit to realize that it would work better if I'd give it a bit of electric juice. I don't advise actual liquids though. I doused my first two with glasses of water, immediately dried them off and stuffed into a bag of rice. Each would still connect to my ipad after water damage, but typing resulted in gobbledygook. Best to keep it dry.
customer_reviews.author: Travel'n Lady

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard but shouldn't be advertised as a stand.
customer_reviews.text: Super Nice keyboard but shouldn't be advertised as a stand. The keyboard has magnets, but it constantly lets the ipad fall backwards. I'm not clumsy or rough. I'm actually trying take good care as both are new. But the ipad fell backwards 3 times in 15 minutes. From researching other places (see Apple store), its experienced by others a fair amount (10% maybe?), and I'm somewhat amazed that Logitech would produce such an 'iffy' solution. I don't think it's defective and I'm sorry to say that Logitech has lost some of my trust. It can only be a matter of time till the ipad suffers damage. I'm still hauling it around for occasional use, but regret purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: RJD

customer_reviews.title: Makes typing on the ipad so much easier!
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for the same keyboard which my dog conveniently spilled coffee all over. (Note: this product won't stand up to liquids being spilled on it. ;)) It both holds the iPad at a convenient angle and provides a typing 'sensation' like using a computer keyboard. The actual size is smaller (obviously) so it takes a little getting used to to but it works very well, connects as soon as yo begin typing and makes emailing way less frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: silverwlf

customer_reviews.title: awesome for 6 months... then...
customer_reviews.text: well, the keyboard still works, still a great keyboard / stand for the iPad BUT the strength of the magnets to make the keyboard a clam cover for the iPad, or the slot that holds the iPad has failed... now the keyboard is only useful as just a keyboard... not a cover. the positive part of keyboard is that it holds a charge for a LONG time... I charge it monthly, and that is about it... with constant use... I thought this was a great product, but I have a dud... I should of just bought a blue tooth keyboard... instead of going to extra cost to make this a clam cover...
customer_reviews.author: Garnie In Texas

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 3 months. Bluetooth connectivity is terrible
customer_reviews.text: Thisnkeyboard failed after three months of use. He Bluetooth connectivity was also not good. iPad took a while to connect to this device vs a Bluetooth headset. The keyboard had inconvenient buttons to be pressed for the Bluetooth search to happen and it wasn’t working as well.
customer_reviews.author: Holden McGroin

customer_reviews.title: The keyboard has a nice feel. The keys are crisp
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use with my ipad and to improve its function as a computer substitute. The keyboard has a nice feel. The keys are crisp, and overall I have been pleased with it. I have had it about 8 months, however, and now the keys are falling off the keyboard, which is very irritating. So far I have lost four, and eventually it will make the keyboard unusable. This is not an inexpensive product, and I expected to get more than a year out of it. Currently, I am looking for a replacement. Hopefully your experience will be better. I would give the product five stars but for the loss of the keys on the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Lone WOlf

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard and your iPad: Perfect Harmony
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. It's perfect for my iPad, they were made for each other, including the aesthetics: the brushed aluminum exterior of the keyboard matches perfectly with the iPad. They keys are easy to type on and positioned well. And in the 2 years that I've had this keyboard, I've had to recharge it once. That's right, once. And I use my iPad a lot. I did a good deal of research before getting this keyboard, and I have no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: arif

customer_reviews.title: Logitech iPad keyboard is worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I never use my desktop computer, so when a friend showed me her Logitech keyboard for her iPad, I decided to get one. I love it! It is great. I still have to do some touch screen stuff but my favorite thing is the angle that the keyboard holds the iPad. It is much steadier than my foldable cover. Also, when the keyboard is closed over the iPad, it is very sturdy and seems to protect my iPad better than my previous leather cover.
customer_reviews.author: Comfort shoe aficionado

customer_reviews.title: sleek and very usable keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a very user friendly keyboard. Doesnt add much weight to the ipad (I am using it on an ipad 2). No connection problems through the bluetooth (I had a brookstone keyboard cover and sometimes it just would not connect.) Has the magnetic cover so when you shut the ipad, the bluetooth on the keyboard shuts down to save power. On my Brookstone, I would forget to turn the keyboard off and it would be out of juice when I went to use it. The only downside is that there is really no protection for the Ipad and keyboard. But is a sleek and useful addition to the ipad 2 and I guess I'll just have to be careful!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It was a difficult choice between this and the leading competitor. I chose Logitech... 1- because of very positive experiences with their other products keyboard products purchased from Logitech 2 - it was very difficult to distinguish the offerings of the leading competition. They had lots of models that all seemed to do the same thing but at different price points. Life is way to short to have to dig through a maze of web pages to learn features and befits. This keyboard is fantastic, the experience is very similar to a full size keyboard. It has greatly enhanced our enjoyment of an IPad. If only Logitech's remote controls were half as good as their keyboards...
customer_reviews.author: Critter

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: When I saw this keyboard/cover advertised in a computer magazine, I knew immediately that it was just what I was wanting. Easy to install and the bluetooth connection worked perfectly. I use the Pages app a lot on my iPad and the built in keyboard was just in the way. This keyboard saved the day for my many on-the-road word processing needs. The most important factor for me was being able to support my iPad in landscape or portrait. As far as drawbacks, the magnet could be a little stronger and the keys are rather close together but I consider both to be minor problems that you get used to quickly.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ervin

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard Out There
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best keyboard made for the iPAD. The keys are soft and nimble the spacing makes it easy for typing. The keyboard can last about 2-3 weeks of constant use. The only thing that I would change is to have Logitech incorporate a light indicator to show how much battery life is left. Their service is phenomenal. After 4 months of use the product stopped charging. I wrote directly to the company and within 72 hours a new keyboard was being shipped to me. No Questions asked. All I had to do was return the product as soon as I received the new one.
customer_reviews.author: StarGazer12

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!  You won't regret it!
customer_reviews.text: I like this keyboard a lot. The flip-up support for holding the IPAD is significantly more secure than the ones that just have a groove to 'catch' the edge of the IPAD. With the limitations of size and thickness, it performs very well. I've been using it for several months now and I have been surprised at how often it lets me untether from my larger laptop. I combined this with an Incase Neoprene Sleeve which was just roomy enough for the IPAD, keyboard, AND an Apple charger and cord.
customer_reviews.author: Paul H.

customer_reviews.title: Anti-Slip rubber insert didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: the rubbery anti-slip sticker inside the groove came off just days after I started using it, and the iPad will simply slip out without it. I didn't have anything equivalent so I had to replace it with some thin felt and a bit of glue, which was not easy. Now it's fine, but doesn't look as refined as the original anti-slip rubber did. But, the keyboard works, it hardly ever needs charging, and it does make the iPad much more user friendly for text. My only other wish would be for an adjustable viewing angle.
customer_reviews.author: N. Zeravla

customer_reviews.title: Useful when it's not in the way
customer_reviews.text: PROS * It's a physical keyboard. Yay. * Connects quickly and reliably when turned on. * Good battery life. * Stands up fine in a lap. CONS * If it's attached and folded shut, you can't easily fold it open to use the iPad. You have to detach the iPad to do anything useful. That's annoying. * The stand only holds the iPad at one angle. The angle is really best suited for a table, as opposed to your lap. Given all of that, I find myself using this to type only when I'm going to write something substantial, but not if I'm writing, say, a URL or search query.
customer_reviews.author: Matt McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: My boss recommended this keyboard to me - she has one and loves it - so when I bought my iPad, I bought the keyboard too. Best move I made with the iPad! I absolutely love this keyboard. It works wonderfully and makes a safe and secure packet out of my iPad when I'm not using it. The keys are nicely sensitive and respond well. As far as I can tell, there is no downside to this keyboard. I like the way it holds the iPad in place at a good angle and steady. I've had no problems with placement or with any aspect of the keyboard. I would highly recommend the keyboard to anyone with an iPad.
customer_reviews.author: D. Vozniak

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Ultrathin Keyboard Cover
customer_reviews.text: I chose this rating, because I purchased a different bluetooth keyboard for $40.00 and realized that I needed a seperate stand for it, it was awkward. The following week I was looking for a car with my roommate and the salesman had this keyboard and showed me it also served as a cover, I was hooked and went online to Amazon, as I always do when I want to save a few bucks. Well I found this one for $66.00, $33 cheaper than the one at the apple store. So I couldn't be happier, the keyboard connects effortlessly, and comes in handy. Everyone has been asking me where I purchased it and I'm happy to tell them at Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Athmysts

customer_reviews.title: Nice, with some drawbacks.
customer_reviews.text: I use this in an iPad gen 3. I like it...the keyboard is fairly comfortable for touch-typists, and it has a fair number of shortcut keys. The only thing I don't like is that it attaches somewhat lightly to the iPad when not in use. You can, for example, hold the iPad under your arm, or the cover and iPad separate. Would be good if it had a band or some other way to hold the keyboard to the iPad more securely when it's not in use. Also, it's not useful holding the iPad in portrait configuration...the iPad slips out of the groove.
customer_reviews.author: JAH

customer_reviews.title: Glue, glue everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: Generally this product works well as a keyboard for the iPad. However, after several months of use a trim piece (where you insert the iPad into the keyboard) came loose and this nasty, sticky glue was everywhere. It doesn't clean up with Goo Gone or any other cleaning product we've used. Apparently this has been a known issue for several years (I've found comments going back to 2012), yet it seems that Logitech has not addressed this design flaw as of July 2014. I've submitted a warranty request with Logitech and will report back on the resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: I like it but......
customer_reviews.text: As a keyboard, it functions well. It's easy to attach and to get to work with the ipad. My complaints would be that it really can't be used as a cover. The magnet slips very easily and you need an additional cover to protect the ipad. Also, when the ipad is sitting up in the slot on the keyboard, it often falls over, which can be very frustrating. The price is considerably better than other units and the battery life is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: K. Beecher

customer_reviews.title: Use it every day
customer_reviews.text: This is a product that has made my iPad SO much more valuable. I use my iPad for everything--reading books, email, Internet, reading magazines, reading blogs, taking classes, blogging, word processing, database, etc. The iPad screen keyboard just made me crazy. I spent 28 years of my life as a high school business teacher. Keyboarding was a class I taught for many years. This keyboard is a great size. I like the feel of the keys. I love the fact that it attaches to the iPad and provides a stand for it. I can't think of one thing I don't like about this keyboard. It has certainly made blogging (and typing of ANY kind) easier.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Schnellenberger

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the refurbished version after reading that the magnet stops working well after much use and some of the bluetooth syncing problems. So far (in the 3 days I have owned this) it has worked great and has been super useful for me! I'm excited to have a keyboard for on the go. Like others have said, if it's not clicked right, the iPad will fall right out of the keyboard and hit the table, (or surface it's on) so thankfully I have Apple Care and won't worry about that! But it's still a little frustrating that it falls out (it has 2x already for me). I say worth the price, especially at the refurbished rate!
customer_reviews.author: Pam Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Okay, is as good as it gets.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use with the iPad3 and the hinge magnets were often not strong enough to keep the keyboard attached when I slid it into my briefcase or carried it in my hand. Likewise, the on/off magnets work mostly to your disadvantage because nothing keeps the iPad & cover closed. When you put it in a briefcase, it falls open & the iPad turns on. The keyboard feels great, the quality and styling are otherwise great and this could have been an outstanding product. I really wanted it to be better and can't believe Logitech allows these design deficiencies to persist.
customer_reviews.author: JTM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent solution for keyboard and stand
customer_reviews.text: My previous iPad was one sold under various names here on Amazon (Accforcity, Sharrk, Maxloop). You can see it here:  I found that every moving part of that case was vulnerable and weak and ultimately broke. There was too much to go wrong. Also, it was a hassle to just open the iPad and use it. In contrast, this Logitech cover is brilliant! I just open the iPad and drop it into place. It's quick to pair, the keys have a very responsive feel, battery life is incredible, it's thin, it's light, what more could you want?!
customer_reviews.author: Melvyn Mildiner

customer_reviews.title: I love this!
customer_reviews.text: I love this!!! This is the second one I've purchased. I purchased the red keyboard from the Apple store and paid $100 for it. I later found out that Amazon had it for $69. I've had it for almost 2 years now and it works great. Use it almost everyday as I work remotely and it comes in handy when not able to transport my laptop. I just purchased the black one for my mother who doesn't do much typing but will use it for a great screen protector/case. Of course it will be helpful when she is seeking to do her internet searches.
customer_reviews.author: Lil Bitz

customer_reviews.title: Best accessory, ever.
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. I am using it to type this review. This thing turns your iPad into a laptop, what's not to absolutely love? I haven't charged it once since I bought it in March... now that's amazing battery life! Automatically connects every time... My one big con is that it doesn't come with Auto-Spellcheck, no biggie, just pay extra attention when you are typing! The cramped style of the keyboard bothered me at first, but your hands get used to that quick. All in all, I am very pleased with this purchase. The keyboard is very light so it doesn't make the iPad that much heavier, and the aluminum is a nice touch. Nifty - Good job Logitech!
customer_reviews.author: Sterling Rose

customer_reviews.title: Amazing keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It is one of the best purchases I have ever done. It has been years since I purchased it and it works perfectly. The battery life is amazing. If you don't use it that much, the battery will last for months, no kidding.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo Morejon

customer_reviews.title: Great product but...
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this product 5 stars because it looks great, the keyboard is excellent and it does exactly what it is supposed to. As others have mentioned, it is not really a protective cover for your iPad, you will need to purchase a sleeve to keep the nice aluminum finish from getting scratched up. In a pinch a hair elastic will hold it together. The "but" relates to the horrific workflow on an iPad. I admire people who can make this work but you must really love your iPad to enjoy working with this combination. I tried it a few times, threw my hands up in frustration and bought a new Chromebook.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Craine

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I found this keyboard to be as good as advertised. It surprisingly is engineered to really lock your iPad in place. The keys are really responsive and very natural feeling. The bluetooth feature syncs well with my iPad. As a cover for my iPad, it is only so-so. The magnetic locking mechanism is good, but it is only magnetic. Therefore, it is prone to dislodgement if you are a little physical or rough with it. So as far as protection for the iPad, it's not the best. The design is very sleek and cool. The cover is very thin and does not add bulk to the iPad.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: best iPad keyboard I have seen.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this right before going to a business conference where I was planning to use my iPad to takes notes. Anyone who has tried to "touch" type on the iPad screen knows it is near impossible. This little keyboard turns your iPad into a netbook. I can type away while having it sit comfortably right on my lap. I have not had to charge it since I purchased it, so the claimed battery life is looking pretty good. The "home" button in the upper left of the keyboard is nice so that you don't have to take your hands on the keyboard to use the iPad "home" button.
customer_reviews.author: S. Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Nicely laid out keyboard
customer_reviews.text: First the Cons: as others have said, the ipad magnet itself is not strong enough to ensure that the keyboard stays in place during transport. It would have been better if the keyboard was designed with a small tab on two or more sides to help it stay in place while acting as a cover. Additionally, when in use, it can only prop up the ipad in the landscape position. The Pros: this is a small keyboard that doesn't perform like one. I have no problems typing at a good clip. The keyboard is well laid out, provides excellent tactile feedback, is responsive, and beautiful. Also, the battery life is phenomenal.
customer_reviews.author: Soapface

customer_reviews.title: Make your iPad more like a work machine
customer_reviews.text: For me, this product has proven very useful. Easy to set up and easy to use. I'm better able to type in anger and regularly make use of capabilities such as the function shortcuts and precision navigation allowed by arrow keys, both of which have greatly reduced my ipad frustrations. When docked in the Logitech keyboard, my ipad3 feels much more like a machine I can do real work on. Great for flights and train journeys too, especially when desk or tray space is very limited. Overall a great product and highly recommended for those wanting to be more productive with their ipads.
customer_reviews.author: LeeP1

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nifty, I wish it kept gripping my iPAD ...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nifty, I wish it kept gripping my iPAD as well as it used to, but other than that - I love it. Long battery life, I can use my ipad as a laptop for all intents. Not having to keep holding up the iPad is a great blessing if you are watching videos or want to sit in a meeting and take notes. Haven't had any issues with it disconnecting too often after being idle overnight or anything. I charge it maybe once a week if that. Given that I paid half of the regular Amazon price (refurbished) I got a pretty good deal.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mujumdar

customer_reviews.title: NOT TOO THRILLED
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard for my iPad as I thought it was the best one you could buy. I was wrong. When I put my iPad on it and tried to move in a more comfortable seating position, the iPad would slide off. I also do not like the layout of the keyboard as it is not a standard one. You would need to spend some time figuring out how to use keys you would normally use. It was very frustrating for me to use this. I wound up buying a different one and am very happy with my choice.
customer_reviews.author: Peanut "Kim"

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: If I could have given it 4 1/2 stars I would have. Great keyboard- It's lightweight and fits so seamlessly with my iPad it looks like it belongs. It was easy to pair and the shortcut keys are helpful. The only drawback is that you can't fold it back (like you would a smart cover) and it falls right off, making it difficult when you just need to use your iPad for a brief period or don't have anywhere to set the keyboard down while traveling. However, I would purchase this same brand/style of keyboard if I ever upgraded my iPad
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Great first impression!
customer_reviews.text: We just got this last night. We opened the box, turned it on, hit Bluetooth on the iPad and we where done! This keyboard has a great look and very nice feel. The keys are maybe a little soft, and the back scratches VERY easily, so make sure to protect it. This is a lightweight and affordable option to the iPad and I recommend it highly. The magnetic connection is great and the landscape mounting is excellent. The portrait mounting is not as solid but still usable if your on a desk or table. If your couch surfing then landscape is the only secure way to use this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip L. Williams

customer_reviews.title: If You Have an iPad, You Need This Keyboard Cover
customer_reviews.text: Not quite sure how I used my iPad effectively before. This keyboard serves as the cover plus an adequately sized keyboard. What's really nice is that you now have a platform for your iPad and you don't have to struggle with finding a way to hold it up. You would think that you would just enable bluetooth on your iPad and turn on the unit and they would pair, but there's more to it than that. You have to hold the little round button on the side until bluetooth finds it.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: This is the best for your iPad...
customer_reviews.text: I had bought my wife the Apple bluetooth keyboard for her iPad and thought that was pretty cool. After seeing this on another iPad, this is the thing to get. Pros: - Charges using a mini-USB connection (same as most phones now) - Connects to your iPad in seconds - Keyboard works great for typing, beats typing using the iPad screen - Keys are very responsive and sized appropriately - It becomes the cover to your iPad screen so it's metal and protects it as such Cons: - Just make sure you keep it charged
customer_reviews.author: J. Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Tired Of Hunting And Pecking At The Screen?
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these to give as gifts to family members who had iPads. They love them. They commented to me that it completes the iPad and makes it a complete computing solution. They charge via a USB port and the battery seems to last for weeks. It's difficult to see in the photos, but when the keyboard is magnetically stored against the iPad, the silver back of the keyboard matches the iPad's resulting in an attractive ultra-book like look. I'd recommend storing the combined unit in a padded sleeve for transport to cut down on the wear and tear on the outsides of the cases though.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Foster

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, but doesn't protect the iPad screen and adds bulk
customer_reviews.text: Transforms your iPad into a ultralight laptop. Very useful, but unfortunately it is a hassle to carry this case around all the time. It does not stick well enough to the iPad to be an effective screen protector once in your backpack or bag. So, you end up needing a protective sleeve for your ipad and have to store the keyboard separately. If you can deal with this, it's a great keyboard. Otherwise, get an iPad case with a built in keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Hammad

customer_reviews.title: Extremely easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: I use this all the time to type notes on my work iPad. Extremely easy to set up and use. I like the feel of the keyboard. It is similar to the one on my laptop. I like the way it holds up my iPad. Again, it almost feels like having a small laptop.I love that I do not have to constantly plug in to recharge. The batteries last a long time if you remember to shut off the keyboard in between use.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: ... keyboards for the ipad but this one was the best. The keys are big enough with enough spacing ...
customer_reviews.text: Tried a few other keyboards for the ipad but this one was the best. The keys are big enough with enough spacing that I can actually use it like my desk top keyboard. I do almost everything on Evernote, so a keyboard is almost a necessity. The batteries last a long time, it pairs beautifully every time and the way it is designed to hold the ipad is well thought out. I like how easily it attaches and detaches with the small but mighty magnets. I use it every day and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tony S.

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I use various apps on my iPad 4 (Evernote, CloudOn, Dropbox, responding to blogs, etc.) where typing on the iPad screen is not easy or productive. The Logitech Ultrathin exceeded my expectations. I am not a touch typist, so after reading several online reviews of "professional" keyboarders who gave it very good reviews but were concerned it was a little tight, I knew I had my keyboard! And the Amazon price is better than big box stores, and as an Amazon Prime member with free 2-day delivery - well, it was an outstanding experience. All my peers were interested in the keyboard, my boss actually bought one himself the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Rog

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality, good feel to the keys
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this keyboard after I returned a different Logitech keyboard I had purchased. I really like the size and feel of this keyboard and the magnetic clam shell design protects the ipad screen nicely. I use keyboards all day long and very particular about the keyboards I like to type on. I find it easy to type on and keys are nicely sized and responsive. Glad I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: doggrrl

customer_reviews.title: Nice cover
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard cover is very handy and does what it's supposed to. Typing is ok, not great, but typing on any small keyboard is going to be a challenge. Key feel is Chiclet and pretty good. Maybe with lots of familiarity, you MIGHT write your novel on this, but I'd still prefer my mechanical KB and desktop. ;) It stays very sturdily in the stand. My only quibble is that the flap magnet could stay on a little more strongly, it slides off pretty easily, but that may just be a general Ipad thing.
customer_reviews.author: D. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for the iPad from a trusted company
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my Logitech Ultrathin keyboard. I bought it used, so I was a bit worried it would be scratched or in less than optimal condition. Fortunately, it was in great condition and am pleased with the purchase. The only thing I wish you could do with this keyboard is fold it back completely when it is attached by the magnetic clips. It disconnects once you fold it back too much. Other than that, I am very pleased with this Logitech keyboard and would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest U

customer_reviews.title: iPad stays at perfect angle and secured by magnet when docked
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard has transformed my iPad back into use again! Slim and attaches with adequate magnetic hinge. I wouldn't want to drop it but if you have the V7 Ultra Protective Shock and WR 10.1" tablet sleeve, you are all set! Keyboard has very positive feel and perfectly sized keys. iPad stays at perfect angle and secured by magnet when docked! It's awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Techspec360

customer_reviews.title: Just what the iPad needed!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, easy to use, this keyboard/cover/stand is so nicely designed it seems like a natural part of the iPad. My only reservation so far is that, used as a stand, my iPad will slip out of it; i.e., it doesn't really hold my iPad reliably enough for me to trust it as I'd like to. But, it succeeds in alleviating the insane disadvantage of Pad computers, to hold it with one hand while trying to type or drag-&-drop with the other. It seems to hold a charge FOREVER and works precisely as promised. If you have an iPad, you need one of these doodads. Ubiquitous Uther King of the Troglodytes
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Great product, good price. First one lasted only 2 years, but still worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard and use it a lot, but gave it four stars because the first one lasted only 2 years. I liked it so much, I bought it again and hope it lasts better. The magnet holds the iPad in place securely and it transforms the iPad into a very small laptop in that you can type so much faster an navigate more easily. Very thin and light, hugely convenient. Highly recommended....until it doesn't work anymore. But for the price- worth it
customer_reviews.author: Mary E Fox

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I had my eye on this for quite a while, but shied away at the retail price tag. So I waited it out till finally I bought this with Amazon gift cards at a great price. Typing on it is very comfortable, which I much prefer over the touch keyboard on the ipad. It also makes for a nice cover, which matches the silver color at the back of the iPad. I use a neoprene sleeve just in case, which is handy for putting the ipad and keyboard on top of it over my lap so I could type. I get stared a lot on the train, probably out of gear envy, hehe.
customer_reviews.author: Arathena

customer_reviews.title: Complete Satisfaction
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard/cover on the recommendation of a friend who had used his for several months to have both protection and a keyboard. After seven months of hard use I remain totally satisfied. The battery lasted so long (six months) that I forgot where I put the charger. Neither the iPad or the cover show any signs of wear - and I'm not particularly careful. I cannot imagine paying double the price for another similar product. It goes to show that a swanky ad and high price don't necessarily guarantee better quality.
customer_reviews.author: FTS

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I am thrilled to death with this keyboard cover! It makes a lot of sense for me. Now, it may not be for everyone... I happen to like the option to remove the keyboard easily from my iPad if I don't want to use one. If you prefer to always have a keyboard then you may want to consider the Zagg Folio. But, for me, this is perfect. It easily attaches and unattaches using the magnetic side of the iPad. It covers the front of the iPad very nicely and the keyboard itself is very nice. It has a nice feel to it and the stand works well.
customer_reviews.author: GrizzledAtoms

customer_reviews.title: and it works great. I no longer use it with the iPad ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this several years ago, and it works great. I no longer use it with the iPad I originally bought it for. I actually use it with my Apple TV, but again, it's a great purchase, one of the best lightweight wireless keyboards you can find.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am SOOOOOO glad to have my arrow keys again!
customer_reviews.text: I was really missing my arrow keys on my iPad and also tired of continually cleaning the screen. This keyboard more than meets my expectations. It has by far been one of my best purchases in a very long time. I love being able to perch my iPad in either portrait or landscape view and use this keyboard. The magnetic strip holds it very securely while I'm using my lap tray unless I tilt the tray too far forward. The only suggestion I have is that Logitech switch to a different plastic surface that isn't as shiny so fingerprints aren't as obvious.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2OneKS

customer_reviews.title: Great for "older" fingers
customer_reviews.text: This is a sleek-looking keyboard case - thin, simple, no unnecessary bells and whistles. For people who are unaccustomed to, or just uncomfortable using the iPad touch screen, this keyboard works like a dream. It functions as a stand, too, keeping the iPad in a firm, angled position. If you own a laptop, you will probably find yourself using the iPad more frequently with this keyboard in place. I researched a number of similar keyboards, and while this one was not the least expensive, the vast majority of positive reviews sold me on it.
customer_reviews.author: Inspiring Insomnia

customer_reviews.title: Buy at your own risk!!
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend this product. The iPad fits into a slot behind the keyboard to hold it into an upright position, there are magnets to keep the iPad in place. These magnets are too weak to hold the iPad and more than once, while using it in this position, it slipped out and fell, one time cracking the glass which had to be replaced. I followed the majority of opinion and purchased this product and had to fork out $200 to replace the glass.
customer_reviews.author: G. Derbes

customer_reviews.title: This makes my iPad 100% more useful
customer_reviews.text: Some have complained about poor quality regarding this keyboard, but I have not experienced this. The fit and finish are superb. The keyboard offers a means to really skedaddle using the iPad and to get some real work done, easily and quickly. Would I buy this again? ABSOLUTELY and you should too. Note: I have also recommended to my computer user group that everyone with an iPad purchase the Logitech Ultrathin keyboard cover. A nice piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: MacWiz

customer_reviews.title: What a find!
customer_reviews.text: Where has this baby been all this time, I have been using mu ipad 3rd generation for a long time now and it bothers me whenever I'm on my desk in the office and want to type something on my ipad. This thing helps so much and makes life easier, its light, easy to carry in my bag and battery last a long time. The best part of this find, amazon warehouse had a refurbish one for $25, it was almost new. It came with just the keyboard and the usb charger but that's all I needed. Instruction manual can be found online.
customer_reviews.author: Agnusdei

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard cover is outstanding in almost every way. It has an incredible battery life, is very accurate, isn't too small for my quite large hands, and does a great job of giving the iPad a very secure and usable position in landscape mode. I only gave it 4 stars because it is not usable in portrait position, and a lot of apps require that, though I would actually give it 4.5 stars if possible. It's probably not possible to make one this thin and elegant that allows for both positions. Bought a second one for my wife. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Spafford

customer_reviews.title: We like it very much and it is definitely worth the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time we bought the Logitech Ultrathin Keyboard. We like it very much and it is definitely worth the money. We had to buy the 2nd one after we used - extensively - the first we bought about 2 years go. After 2 years of daily use, two keys became unresponsive; and only when you have to, you realize how annoying it is to have switch to on-screen keyboard ... So again, very much worth the money, and lots of usage, but after several years of use it will wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Mayumi L Wille

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Ultrathin Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy this again. The keyboard response is too slow and misses letters for my speed of typing. It is, however, nice in its compact size. I agree with an earlier reviewer who commented on the weak magnet holding it to the IPAD as a cover. I like the fact that it acts like a cover, but I don't I don't trust it to be secure. However, the magnet holding the IPAD in landscape mode only when the keyboard is in use is very strong and makes this look like a mini laptop. That I like a lot. It's only strong in landscape mode. The bluetooth is good.
customer_reviews.author: Carol A. Oman

customer_reviews.title: Thus far this is a wonderful keyboard cover
customer_reviews.text: Thus far this is a wonderful keyboard cover. The screen stays in position well, and the keyboard is not always on. Sometimes, I like to use the ipad as a camera, and this cover makes that easier than my previous Belkin cover. I hope the battery lasts and the bluetooth continues to work, since the bluetooth connection was a problem with the Belkin cover.
customer_reviews.author: mr. sock

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this keyboard . . .
customer_reviews.text: I had this keyboard for 2 years and it starting experiencing erratic behavior such as repeating letters and having screen keyboard popup when it "appears" to be connected to the Bluetooth . . . this is extremely frustrating. Thinking I had just worn it out I purchased another one only to experience the same issues with the new one. I am very, very disappointed that these keyboards are not performing as they should. I have read on-line about this issue and it's very common with these Logitech keyboards and it doesn't seem Logitech is doing anything to rectify the situation. I will not buy another and suggest you don't either. My sister is experiencing the same issues with hers
customer_reviews.author: Oleta D. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Loved the idea of this
customer_reviews.text: Loved the idea of this, but in application, it just doesn't do much for me. I rarely ever use it. Part of the issue is, it was a refurb, and didn't close properly. For this reason, it wouldn't turn off the iPad. Sent it back and got another one just like it - and I mean JUST LIKE IT. Pretty much meant I needed to buy an external soft cover. Long story short, I rarely ever use either one any more. This would be one item you should probably check out in-store to make sure it fits/works correctly. Otherwise, what's the point?
customer_reviews.author: JEM

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect keyboard/cover
customer_reviews.text: the keyboard is great especially for those like me who have big fingers and find the on screen keyboard cumbersome and get tired of thumb typing. With this keyboard the keys are large enough for easy typing and the function keys come in handy and help with routine tasks. Although I gave 5 stars it would be better if this were a case instead of a keyboard cover. It does provide exceptional protection for the screen but it is not an attractive case and requires a sleeve but this is minimal as this is the best low profile thin cover available.
customer_reviews.author: just me

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I really like the way this product complements the iPad. Wish that there was a magnet or some type of flap that held it tighter to the iPad when closed, but this isn't really to big a deal. Heard others are using Velcro strips to help keep it closed. But when I pare this with the amazon basics netbook bag, I place the ipad with this doc open side down. So gravity and the bag will insure it stays closed. The magnets on on both the attachment piece and the dock groove are strong and satisfying. Overall I'm glad I ordered this product.
customer_reviews.author: David N.

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Makes a pad useful for meeting
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Makes a pad useful for meeting, notes, and more extensive writing. After several years of heavy use, a few of the buttons dislodged. I don'' use an iPad anymore in preference for a different brand, but if I did, I'd immediately buy this product again. Oh, I suppose the only thing that might confuse someone is - it's not a heavy duty cover. Meaning, the product is substantial enough, but this is not a protective case other than for maybe scratches. It's a cover, it says on with magnets. If you drop it, then this cover isn't going to protect your pad in any meaningful way.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Walker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect iPad 2 Partner
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard mates with the iPad to form a protective clamshell. It's amazingly light and thin, and the appearance matches the iPad perfectly. Bluetooth pairing is easy, and it turns the iPad into a useful writing tool. I've never been able to peck out anything long on the screen keyboard, but with the Logitech unit emails, spreadsheets, and even article writing are all possible. Don't expect a full-travel desktop keyboard feel, but the light weight and slender profile make for a worthy tradeoff.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Dooley

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard for the IPAD
customer_reviews.text: After trying several of the keyboard for the mini I settled on this one for the regular IPAD. Extremely light in weight to carry around. Negligible Bulk, but does an elegant job of typing, clear concise keys to get the different tasks done. Drawback is that I still have to use the gestures in lieu of the arrow keys. As per the manual the arrow keys are based on the app developers support. Also, I have to figured out or there is no explanation on how to navigate through the folders and select the app when you have them nested.
customer_reviews.author: Hiten J. Thakkar

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I do love the fact that this keyboard makes it 10x easier to use an iPad, especially when writing long emails or taking notes at a meeting. The only thing that kept me from giving it 5 stars is that sometimes the magnetic strip fails in which case I have to bust out my Matrix moves and quickly snatch my iPad before it hits the floor and shatters. Also, sometimes it takes the blutooth a while to recognize the iPad when you attach it, causing me to constantly click the side button to make sure it's connected
customer_reviews.author: Masha

customer_reviews.title: It is just a little crammed together which causes a few letter errors here and there but so much better than the virtural keyboa
customer_reviews.text: The Logitech keyboard works well. It is just a little crammed together which causes a few letter errors here and there but so much better than the virtural keyboard of the I Pad. I rated it 4 stars only because there is no "lock" or catch to hold the I Pad/keyboard closed. It closes and gravity holds it that way. I would really like to have had a latch or whatever to keep it honest so to speak. A nice addition though to the I Pad.
customer_reviews.author: Will Berninger Whitewater Aviation Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Logitech or Zagg
customer_reviews.text: I purchased both the Logitech Ultra thing and the Zagg ProKeys. Like everyone says the Logitech is thinner and lighter but that gives it a cheaper feel. The magnets on the hinge are a bit week and there is nothing to hold it in the closed position. The magnets in the groove are strong and hold the iPad secure. The Zagg is solid and I like the extra row of shortcut keys. It does not hold the iPad as well in the groove but have not had any issues with this. I decided to keep the Zagg and passed along the Logitech. Both are great so it would come down to the features more important to you.
customer_reviews.author: David Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Great, sturdy keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I have had this keyboard for my iPad 2 for years and it is fantastic. It's holding up very well, hardly ever needs charging. It serves as an excellent case too.
customer_reviews.author: BLF

customer_reviews.title: Good functioning keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Keyboard works well and typing is a breeze. I can turn the iPad either way and the keyboard still works. Charge lasts a long time. Cons: Even though it is fairly light, It definitely adds more weight than I would like. I would like it better if the back had something to grip so it wasn't slippery. I use an additional protective cover with a handle that I carry around, but it doesn't solve the problem of the iPad being slippery and my concern for dropping it and the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: An avid reader and consumer

customer_reviews.title: myPad just became an iComputer !!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing keyboard for my iPad 2. Low profile, thin and sleek design and has raised my productivity to the max. Had used folio keyboards before getting this and this just makes working on iPad so much fun. One drawback however, it is very smooth and does not stick to the surface while you work on it, so you need to be extra careful not to drop it from your table whenever you work. Forget about keeping it on your lap and working as a laptop, this is way too small for that. Rest, 5 Stars for design, quality, price, productivity and making iPad cover that looks and feels like as if it was made by Apple itself.
customer_reviews.author: N. Sharma

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product!
customer_reviews.text: I read about this keyboard on Profhacker, and it does everything the reviewer said. It's a great protective case for the iPad, and the keyboard feels real (not mushy, as in 1st-generation cases). It's easy to set up and easy to type on. The slot for the iPad is magnetic, so the iPad clicks in and doesn't move. I had been using the Apple wireless keyboard, which was fine except that it was cumbersome to hold the keyboard and the iPad on your lap if there wasn't a table handy. With this keyboard, that's not a problem; you can even lift the iPad and the keyboard stays attached.
customer_reviews.author: mbluth1

customer_reviews.title: NO nanufaturer warranty
customer_reviews.text: Up date May21, 2014. My Ultrathin keyboard is not working properly and The seller is not an authorized Logitech dealer and the warranty will not be honored. And there response when I requested assistance from Deals4U was contact the manufacturer. It is not stated the item is grey market and carries no warranty. Beware! Came on time in perfect condition, just perfect for my ipad 3. Keyboard connects quickly and reconnects automatically. Nice aluminum finish, sturdy and doesn't scratch the screen.Magnetic latch shuts off ipad.
customer_reviews.author: BarryP

customer_reviews.title: Awesome case and Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I use my Ipad for work and wanted something that would stay together. I love it. the keyboard id flat so it makes it very comfortable to type, no lips on the sides like some other cases. The magnetic stripe of white to hold the screen works great. You can pick up the ipad and the scree stays connected to the keyboard. Only issue that I have come across is that is did scratch my screen protector over time. It left a line where the white line is on the keyboard. I still love it.
customer_reviews.author: Krista Dudek

customer_reviews.title: Oh yeah!
customer_reviews.text: I needed and wanted a way to be more productive on my iPad and I found it when I purchased this keyboard (twice - one for home and one for work). The keys are really responsive and it holds a charge really well. It also acts as a cover for the device and doesn't add extra, unnecessary weight. The iPad fits snugly in landscape mode but I would feel anxious about putting it in portrait mode. While this keyboard may be pricier than the rest you will find, I would say it is the best to work with your tablet.
customer_reviews.author: La Negrita

customer_reviews.title: OK but...
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Works great as a keyboard Keys work and feel great. Connects to bluetooth quick and simple. Magnetic tab works great and attaches easily. Good landscape view Con: Doesn't really protect the iPad. Since it is magnetic even throwing it on the bed will cause the cover to dislocate. Magnetic hinge seems flimsy. can ONLY do landscape. The middle bar, which is used as the stand, is also magnetic. As a result, you can only do landscape mode. If you try to turn the iPad to portrait, it won't work, since the bottom and top are not magnetic, and it doesn't hold well.
customer_reviews.author: Joejv

customer_reviews.title: Great asset for iPad
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this keyboard. It is well-designed, and fits the iPad 3 perfectly. Clever piece of engineering I think. I have big hands, but I can comfortably type with the smaller keyboard format. Bluetooth is good, have not charged battery in the 30 plust days I've had it (supposed to last 6 months on a charge.) The magnets are not an issue at all, the unit locks squarely in place when closed. Just about same form factor as the iPad itself, so it is still a thin device when closed. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: T. Patnode

customer_reviews.title: Best keypad for iPad I've used!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is great! It turns your iPad into an awesome protective case when not in use. It's makes iPad just as effective as a laptop (with proper apps: Pages, Keynote) It's also a nice size so you don't feel like you're on a mini keyboard. The only thing I wish it had was an automatic shut off when not in use. It gets 4-5 hours but I always forget to turn off the little switch and it's dead when I go to use it the next time. That by no means is the fault of the device (all me!). Just remember to turn off and you'll be set.
customer_reviews.author: Guinevere

customer_reviews.title: Light and efficient - love it, but not the price
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up and Bluetooth works great. tried the Zagg - protective, but way more than needed and very heavy and thick. transporting the iPad with the Logitech Ultrathin is easy - fits in most larger purses these days without a lot of extra weight. on and off the keypad, landscape to portrait - all in a snap. long battery life too. mine is about 2 years old..."S" key has started sticking some times, but it's gotten a lot of wear. Would give it 5 stars, but the price is not yet competitive enough.
customer_reviews.author: BeOutside

customer_reviews.title: Great bluetooth keyboard and cover
customer_reviews.text: I would have rated this keyboard 5 stars; but because I have a cover on the back of my iPad, sometimes the iPad will slip out of the slot. I then remove the back cover so the iPad can fit nicely in the slot. Or sometimes, I leave the back cover on and forego putting the iPad in the slot. Typing is so much better than using the iPad keyboard. Has convenient home key, up and down arrows, and other keys that any MAC user would be familiar with (ctrl/option/cmd). Battery life is excellent; I have only done the initial charge since purchase a month ago. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife's new ipad. 67th generation or something like that. The keyboard works great, does what a keyboard is supposed to. Can be used as a case for the front of the ipad or you can prop it on the front and use it like a little laptop. It's all magnetic which is cool. At first I thought the ipad would just slip off but it's a pretty strong magnet or something. I don't know, it's science. Only complaint and why I didn't give it five stars is because it only protects the screen. If you don't get a skin or some other added protection the back will get scratched.
customer_reviews.author: Derrek

customer_reviews.title: Love it, with a few design flaws.
customer_reviews.text: I love logitech keyboards for ipads, by far the best choice with a few blips. This one slips when you type on slick surfaces, like a table or desk, so I added some minor stick on rubber feet to grip. First one got knocked around too much and a few of the keys loosened and fell out. No way to repair it, so I ordered another. Extremely convenient and creates a desktop like use for your ipad. Ideal for college note taking in class.
customer_reviews.author: Penny

customer_reviews.title: I like this product
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. My ipad is stable and secure on it and the magnet holds well. I just wish, as I do with all new technology that I buy, that it came with instructions. I don't know how you can tell when the battery is low and it would be nice if there were some kind of an indicator light or something that would show that the charge it low. Overall though, it is a good product. Not too heavy, keyboard set up like others and the magnet works well.
customer_reviews.author: Cef
